The reception told us this room would be more spacious and we (as a couple) could just choose which bed to sleep in, as it had two double bed. Unfortunately, the beds were pretty small doubles, so I can only imagine they were smaller than the standard double room bed size, which is understandable if one person is anticipated to sleep in each bed, but as a couple, I don't know if this was really a good upgrade to have been given. Additionally, there was loud music playing until the early hours of the morning, which didn't help with obtaining a comfortable nights sleep. In the morning, we had also paid for breakfast to be included. On making our way to the breakfast room we were taken to a table and given a menu with priced item, no explanation. After being left for a considerable amount of time, the same waiter came back and asked if we'd been served. We proceeded to ask about the breakfast, being understanding that buffet style is not suitable in the current global situation, but being a little confused having been given a menu with different prices and options and not knowing what exactly our prepayment entitled us to. Once explained we ordered from the menu as directed, however the resulting dishes were disappointing at most. With a very small offering to begin with, you'd hope the dishes were at least worthy of their spot on the menu. Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews:
We stayed for 1 night as a treat, after my sons weekend of coding/robotics championships at the Macqaurie University.  
We chose this hotel due to location to Darling Harbour and its sights (approx 15 min walk) and Wynyard train station (approx 3 - 5 min walk), which would take us to the Domestic Airport the next day.  The Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge are also only 15 min walk each away.
I was pleasantly surprised when we got an upgraded room (1st time upgraded ever...hoo hoo)  We were originally booked for a standard double room with atrium view, and ended up with 2 double beds with street views.  The bathroom was enormous, and all areas scrupulously clean, and loved that I had a massive bed to myself!!  I enjoyed seeing the old photos in the hallways of the historic building.
We went to Darling harbour for dinner, and there were plenty of choices to choose from (Bars, Seafood, Steak Houses, Hard Rock, Australian etc)  I researched cafes for breakfast (and there were plenty of options nearby), but my son loves a good hotel buffet, so we did that as a treat.  Had the usual buffet fare.
Our flight didn't leave until 8pm on the day of check out, so loved that we were able to leave our bags at concierge until about 5pm, so we could continue to sightsee without lugging them around with us.
Its a pity we only had 1 night.
